page.title: 18Local Government Structure
page.content: Somerset County Council forms the top tier in the local government structure. It controls a wide range of activities affecting the lives of the people in this area. These include Education and the much appreciated mobile library service. The county is divided into five districts and this area is within the Taunton Deane District. This council has many responsibilities including local roads, footpaths, leisure and recreational facilities and planning. Each district is divided into many parishes and this area is partly in Oake, Bradford-on-Tone and Norton Fitzwarren. There are elected representatives at all levels of local government. Members of parish councils have little power and serve mainly to discuss and draw attention to local problems.
